page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: This land of rocky hills has given abundantly of its riches since the Romans worked them for lead and now they are quarried for their sandstone.Many of the farmhouses and houses are built of the local stone and all are well maintained. There are several pre-1939 council houses made of brick. Many farms have had bungalows built next to them for the farmers use.Is this the modern trend we wonder? Many new properties have been built of reconstituted stone most of which were owner occupied and all were well maintained. A number of professional people from nearby towns have settled in the area preferring a rural environment.
